availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John N. Wallingsford (Fleming County, Kentucky, merchant and adjutant (U.S.A.))

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Hiram Wallingsford and Hannah Wallingsford. Resident in Mount Carmel, Fleming County, Kentucky in 1850. Merchant in Fleming County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the Tenth Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as adjutant from August 8, 1862 to September 17, 1863. Clerk for Steamboat H. M. Childs in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Mount Carmel, p. 349A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 630.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 250.
Find A Grave, "John N. Wallingford (1840- 1907)," Memorial #48386120, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48386120 (accessed September 25, 2019).
KYR-0002-222-0103.
